title: Eco Accommodations
description: Choose accommodations that prioritize sustainability, such as eco-resorts in the Sundarbans or Cox's Bazar that use renewable energy and waste management systems.

title: Reusable Items
description: Bring your own reusable water bottles, shopping bags, and utensils to reduce plastic waste. Many cafes and markets are beginning to encourage reusable items.

title: Public Transport
description: Use public transport like buses, CNG taxis, or rickshaws in cities like Dhaka to reduce your carbon footprint. Carpooling and ride-sharing apps also provide eco-friendly options.

title: Support Local
description: Support local businesses by purchasing handmade crafts and eating at local eateries. This helps the local economy and reduces the environmental impact of imported goods.

title: Respect Nature
description: Follow guidelines in wildlife sanctuaries and national parks like the Sundarbans and Srimangal to preserve natural habitats and protect wildlife such as Bengal tigers.

title: Limit Flights
description: Try to limit short domestic flights and use more sustainable modes of transport like trains for journeys between cities such as Dhaka to Chattogram.

title: Pack Light
description: Pack only what you need to reduce luggage weight and minimize fuel consumption. This also helps you navigate transport systems with limited luggage space.

title: Offset Emissions
description: Support tree planting and local environmental programs to offset the carbon emissions from your travel. Some agencies may offer options to donate to such initiatives.

title: Reduce Waste
description: Be mindful of waste by bringing reusable containers and recycling when possible. Avoid single-use plastics and dispose of trash responsibly in designated bins.

title: Eco Activities
description: Participate in eco-tours and community-based tourism that promote environmental education and sustainable travel, such as wildlife tours in the Sundarbans or Srimangal.
